title: bw_grid behaviour changed
body:
Hi Adrian (@adalca),

I was recently trying to use again the bw_grid to visualize a vector field but it looks like that something changed in the behaviour of numpy (I am using numpy 1.18). I am not able to get a nice grid anymore and I am also not sure about the correctness of the implementation. 
You recently added a thickness parameter but I think the thickness should be taken into account also in this line:
https://github.com/adalca/pytools-lib/blob/7013bcc40b686bf94eb5bd2f2de2793cc1711660/pynd/ndutils.py#L134
and in line:
https://github.com/adalca/pytools-lib/blob/7013bcc40b686bf94eb5bd2f2de2793cc1711660/pynd/ndutils.py#L135
there is a warning about deprecation that I guess could be solved by using tuple() for indexing.

This is a small example:
`grid_img = bw_grid((128, 256, 512), 10)
plt.imshow(grid_img[55, :, :], cmap='gray')`
![example1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6599726/81430463-bc94a400-915f-11ea-9dd7-a0e8f609d8d8.png)

`grid_img = bw_grid((128, 256, 512), 10)
plt.imshow(grid_img[: , 55, :], cmap='gray')`
![example2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6599726/81430518-d635eb80-915f-11ea-9dd1-f9d8a850ae61.png)

`grid_img = bw_grid((128, 256, 512), 10)
plt.imshow(grid_img[: , :, 55], cmap='gray')`
![example3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6599726/81430588-f1086000-915f-11ea-80d5-31835ce9aeb6.png)
